text:

alive? Her pencil is broken, but her notes, her warnings from this new world 
are far from complete. 
[Hissing static starts] 
ARCHIVIST (CONT’D) 
She snaps off another rib and continues writing. 
(A soft sigh from the Archivist) 
[Hissing static ends] 
ARCHIVIST (CONT’D) 
Right. 
[Tape clicks off] 
[Tape clicks on] 
[Sounds of distant air raid sirens, distorted crow caws, and trash 
movement] 
[Martin and the Archivist walk, their crunching footsteps 
occasionally kicking away trash] 
MARTIN 
You know what? I am sitting down. 
[They stop walking] 
ARCHIVIST 
Are… you sure? That thing is... that's not in great shape. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
9 
MARTIN 
(Unfazed) Neither am I. I have been on my feet for a literally uncountable 
amount of time. 
[Martin walks to a soggy couch; as he sits his backpack zippers 
jangle, and the couch emits a tired creak and wet squishing] 
(Martin forces out a satisfied sound) 
ARCHIVIST 
How is it? 
MARTIN 
(Forced) Great. It's great. 
[Creak and squelch from the couch] 
MARTIN (CONT’D) 
Lovely couch. 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. Well, rest up, I suppose! 
[Patting noise] 
MARTIN 
It's a two-seater! 
ARCHIVIST 
(Not interested) Yes it is! 
(Slight amused exhale) 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
10 
[Another damp creak of the couch] 
ARCHIVIST (CONT'D) 
Hard pass, thank you. 
[The couch squelches as Martin settles further on it] 
(Beat) 
MARTIN 
What was it like? 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
MARTIN 
This place's— its statement. 
ARCHIVIST 
Not too surprising. It's a domain designed to eke fear out of those afraid of a 
world destroyed by human hands. It, uh… It dwells on it. 
MARTIN 
Hm. 
[Wet creak as Martin shifts on the couch] 
MARTIN (CONT’D) 
So it was real then, the Extinction? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
11 
ARCHIVIST 
Of course it was real. A-at least in the sense that, it was a thing people feared. 
Whether it was strong enough in its own right to be considered at a level with 
Smirke's Fourteen, or, whether it was on its way to getting there, I… maybe. 
This sort of thing is always… muddy. 
MARTIN 
So Peter was lying. 
ARCHIVIST 
(Sighs) To a degree. But, mostly he was just like anyone else who tried to take 
the scope of human terror and, package it neatly into little theories. All his talk 
of Emergence and, birthing a new power, it's just people being scared. 
[Damp couch creak as Martin shifts; it continues to creak irregularly 
whenever he speaks] 
MARTIN 
What, so no one had any idea? 
ARCHIVIST 
Martin, I have the whole scope of human knowledge available to me, and 
(sigh) I'd struggle to give you a simple answer to most of this stuff. And even if 
I am omniscient, I'm starting to realize that... doesn't mean objective. 
MARTIN 
Hm. 
(Sigh) I guess it's hard not to bring your own baggage to this sort of thing. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
12 
ARCHIVIST 
I don't know if it could even exist without the baggage. You want to talk about 
psychological projection, try viewing the metaphysical world through the lens 
of a being that is, by its very nature, a reflection of your own obsessions and 
fears. 
MARTIN 
(Sigh) Yeah, alright. I get it. But what about the, real world, were they right? 
ARCHIVIST 
I-I'm not sure I follow. 
MARTIN 
I mean— Right, if none, if none of this had happened, if the world had just… 
carried on? What would have happened? Was, was all that fear justified? 
ARCHIVIST 
I can't know the future, Martin, not even a hypothetical one. 
MARTIN 
But, you know what was going on, what was happening. O-out of everyone, 
you're the best placed, you, you've got the info to make a pretty damn 
educated guess! 
ARCHIVIST 
I, I don't know what you want me to say, Martin. Yes, i-it was bad, worse than 
most people thought and, things were only going to deteriorate. Was the end
